text.name: ui_intro_text_1
text.text: To get started, use Manage Groups to create a Group. A Standard group is a logical container for related tasks, for example 'Field 10', or 'General Farm Tasks'.

text.name: ui_intro_text_2
text.text: Once you have made a group, use Manage Tasks to define things you need to do and when. Tasks will show in here as active tasks when due.

text.name: ui_intro_text_3
text.text: You can also create a Template group, for example 'Wheat Field'. You define tasks as you do with a normal group, and then create multiple Template Instance groups that use the template.

text.name: ui_intro_text_4
text.text: A Template itself does not generate active tasks, but will produce tasks for all associated Template Instance groups.

text.name: ui_intro_text_5
text.text: A task is just plain text, such as 'Harvest Corn'. You can define the priority (1 is highest) and the relative effort required.

text.name: ui_intro_text_6
text.text: Tasks can be one off things or recur by month or day, or by a multiple of months of days. If you have animals, you can automatically raise tasks if food levels get low.

text.name: ui_intro_text_7
text.text: When a task is due it will show in the main view in priority order. Use 'Complete Task' when it is done. If it is a recurring task, it will show again when next due.

text.name: ui_intro_text_8
text.text: Choose 'Switch Mode' to alternate between a view of tasks currently due, and a planning tool, showing the total effort for each month and upcoming tasks by month.

text.name: ui_intro_text_9
text.text: A group and all of its tasks can be easily copied to a new group if needed.

text.name: ui_intro_text_10
text.text: You can view tasks currently due while playing by pressing Shift + T.
